title: Understanding the Hess's Law Concept
text: Hess's Law states that the enthalpy change of a chemical reaction is the same, no matter the route taken. This means you can rearrange given reactions to obtain the desired reaction, then sum their enthalpy changes.

title: Identify Target and Given Reactions
text:
Reactions given:
$$1$$. CH₂CO+2O₂→2CO₂+H₂O (Δ$$H_1$$=-981.1kJ)
$$2$$. CH₄+2O₂→CO₂+2H₂O (Δ$$H_2$$=-802.3kJ)

Target reaction:
2CH₄+2O₂→CH₂CO+3H₂O

To obtain the target reaction, scale reaction 2 by 2 without reversing it. Determine if you need to reverse reaction 1 to match the target reaction.
